page.title: 04LIFE & SOCIAL LIFE, CARNELL
page.content: Ages range from babies to octogenarians. Children attend a local primary school on the perimeter of the area. Secondary pupils travel to Kilmarnock six miles distant. University students mainly go to Glasgow. The main employment is on farms or estate or to town factories, shops and nursing. Life is truly rural and idyllic for those who appreciate the beauty of the area; soul destroying if the bright city lights beckon. There is no school, no church or social centre within the area. Villages are four miles distant, viz; Mauchline Galston, Hurlford, Tarbolton and Craigie. Inns, churches, shops and social centres are located here. There is no bus service, the nearest is two miles away. The majority of residents have cars.
